intro: Comesperma hirtulum, commonly known as the hairy comesperma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. It is often found in shrublands and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
